title: What makes The Scarlet Letter a romance? - Quora

response.answer_text: I suppose it depends what exactly you mean. It could be considered a gothic “romance” in the sense that it involves an illicit/criminal (because adultery was a crime) love affair between two central characters. On the other hand, it is “romantic” in the sense that it includes elements that aren’t entirely realistic, with strange supernatural(ish) incidents (like the scarlet letter A appearing in the sky at night); it’s a fantastic story in the sense that it involves fantastical elements. I was disappointed, though: I’d understood it to be “romantic” in the sense that it would have dirty bits… more fool me, should’ve known that the Puritans wouldn’t have it in ‘em. :)
